RADICAL.Definition: believing or expressing the belief that there should be great or extreme social or political change

WAGE.Definition: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education

MOCKED.Definition: to laugh at someone, often by copying them in a funny but unkind way

INEFFICIENT.Definition: not organised, skilled, or able to work in a satisfactory way

ENLIGHTENED.Definition: showing understanding, acting in a positive way, and not following old-fashioned or false beliefs

DEVIATION.Definition: to do something that is different from the usual or common way of behaving

DICTATES.Definition: to give orders, or tell someone exactly what they must do, with total authority

SHAREHOLDERS.Definition: a person who owns shares in a company and therefore gets part of the company's profits and the right to vote on how the company is controlled

HIGH LIFE.Definition: an exciting way of living in which rich and successful people enjoy themselves by spending a lot of time and money in fashionable places

ALL OF THE TRAPPINGS.Definition: all the things that are part of or typical of a particular job, situation, or event

MAKE ENDS MEET.Definition: to have just enough money to pay for the things that you need

THINK LONG AND HARD.Definition: to think very carefully about something

CORRELATION.Definition: a connection or relationship between two or more facts, numbers, etc.

CRUNCHED THE NUMBERS.Definition: to do mathematical work involving large amounts of information or numbers

CEO.Definition: abbreviation for chief executive officer the person with the most important position in a company

PREDICTED.Definition: to say that an event or action will happen in the future, especially as a result of knowledge or experience

CASE STUDY.Definition: a detailed account giving information about the development of a person, group, or thing, especially in order to show general principles

MBA.Definition: abbreviation for Master of Business Administration: an advanced degree in business, or a person who has this degree

RESIGNED.Definition: to give up a job or position by telling your employer that you are leaving

INFLUX.Definition: the fact of a large number of people or things arriving at the same time

DUST HAD SETTLED.Definition: If the dust settles after an argument or big change, the situation becomes calmer

MEDIA COVERAGE.Definition: the reporting of a particular important event or subject by the media

FOLLOWED HIS LEAD.Definition: followed the example of someone or something

CUSHION.Definition: something that makes the effects of a bad situation less severe

CUSTOMER BASE.Definition: the people who buy or use a particular product or service

LUXURY.Definition: great comfort, especially as provided by expensive and beautiful things

PLAIN SAILING.Definition: to be easy and without problems

REVENUE.Definition: the income that a government or company receives regularly

NOSEDIVED.Definition: a fast and sudden fall to the ground with the front pointing down

ADVOCATE.Definition: to publicly support or suggest an idea, development, or way of doing something

STOCKS.Definition: part of the ownership of a company that can be bought by members of the public

HAZARD PAY.Definition: extra money that is paid to someone because their job is dangerous

FRONTLINE.Definition: used to describe an employee who deals directly with customers, or who is directly involved in making a product

NET WORTH.Definition: the value of the assets (= property and money) that a​ person or ​business has, after any ​debts are taken away

WEATHER.Definition: to deal successfully with a difficult situation or a problem
